parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (CMF1124003) at the end. This strongly suggests electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are mandatory for electoral campaign materials in Romania.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>While the post doesn't explicitly name a candidate, the image clearly shows a person and the text mentions "Poziția 12 pe buletinul de vot" (Position 12 on the ballot).  Combined with the PNCR logo, this directly refers to a specific party (Partidul Național Conservator Român) and its position on the ballot for the parliamentary elections. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently targeting a wide audience. The message is not a private communication but aims to reach many people in Arad County, as evidenced by the targeting data in the `insights` section. This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to encourage voters to choose the PNCR party (position 12 on the ballot).  Phrases like "Ieși la vot!", "Alege schimbarea", and the emphasis on the party's position on the ballot paper clearly aim to influence voting behavior. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not adhere to journalistic standards. It lacks objectivity and presents a biased perspective promoting a specific political party. It's not providing news or analysis but rather advocating for a particular outcome in the election.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a clear and direct appeal for votes for a specific party. The use of the CMF number further confirms its nature as electoral propaganda.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>3992315094428233</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a specific party (PNCR) participating in the parliamentary elections, uses a CMF number, targets a wide audience through a paid Facebook advertisement, and has the clear objective of influencing voters to support the PNCR. The content is not journalistic or a personal opinion but rather a direct appeal for votes.  The post's timing (after the official campaign period) is also a crucial factor.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>PNCR</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PNCR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
LIBRA OFFICE IND. SRL, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei reclame plătite pe Facebook (ID postare: 3992315094428233) care promovează Partidul Național Conservator Român (PNCR), utilizând imaginea unui candidat și menționând poziția acestuia pe buletinul de vot ("Poziția 12 pe buletinul de vot"), având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea PNCR, fapt demonstrat prin prezența numărului CMF (CMF1124003) și prin conținutul explicit al mesajului care îndeamnă la vot pentru PNCR ("Ieși la vot!", "Alege schimbarea").  Reclama nu respectă prevederile legale privind încheierea campaniei electorale și constituie propagandă electorală interzisă.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
